prompt: Using the drop-down menu, select the best revision to the second underlined portion of sentence 1.
feedback: The correct answer is correct for two reasons: (1) the verbs “rise and leeks” are part of the clause, “when magma . . into the crust.” For this reason, they need to agree with the subject of the clause, “magma” Only the verbs “rises” and “leaks” agree with the subject “magma”; (2) The words “leeks and leaks” are homonyms. The word “leeks” is a noun that means an edible plant related to an onion. The word “leaks” is a verb that means to escape through a crack. The incorrect answers either do not use the homonym correctly and/or do not have correct subject/verb agreement.
